schema.name: mAdminState
schema.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
schema.label: Enable administrative state
schema.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
schema.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

The correlation path specifies the part of the API definition that correlates with the assembly action. This path is exposed in the debug data by the API Gateway for use by debugging tools. For example, for an API configuration that is retrieved from API Connect and specified in an OpenAPI (Swagger 2.0) document with IBM extensions, this path is the JSON path to the assembly policy in the IBM extensions section of the document. The path can be expressed in any form that the debugging tool can correlate to the API definition.
schema.summary: The path which correlates the assembly action to a specific part of the API specification.
schema.name: CorrelationPath
ActionDebug
schema.summary: Whether to enable GatewayScript debugger in assembly actions
schema.description: <p>Controls whether to enable the GatewayScript debugger to troubleshoot the following GatewayScript file or script. <ul><li>Troubleshoot the GatewayScript file that is called from the assembly GatewayScript action.</li><li>Troubleshoot the GatewayScript file that is invoked by the GatewayScript associated XSLT extension functions or elements, such as the <tt>gatewayscript()</tt> extension function, from the assembly XSLT action.</li><li>Troubleshoot the GatewayScript script that is invoked through the <tt>value</tt> or the <tt>default</tt> property in the JSON file from the assembly map action.</li></ul></p><p>To debug a file or script, the following conditions must be met:</p><ul><li>The file contains one or more <tt>debugger;</tt> statements at the points in your script where you want to start debugging.</li><li>The GatewayScript debugger is enabled.</li></ul><p>Then you can run the <tt>debug-action</tt> command to debug.</p>

Specifies the OAuth token provider settings to use for OAuth action. You can use one or more of the following methods, precedence rules apply when you configure the same aspect of the OAuth provider settings through multiple methods.

property.name: URL
property.summary: Specifies the URL of a resource with one or more properties for the dynamic object
property.description: Specifies a URL to a file that contains serialized XML or JSON properties to be merged into the dynamic object. These properties override any existing literal or default properties. The URL can contain variable references, and fields within the associated file can also contain variable references.

Specifies a literal string that defines serialized XML or JSON properties for merging into the dynamic object. These properties override the existing default properties. The literal string can contain variable references.
property.summary: Specifies a literal configuration string with one or more properties for the dynamic object
property.name: Literal

property.description: Specifies an existing object from which to retrieve default property values for the dynamic object. If an object is not specified, then the URL reference, the literal configuration, or the combination of URL reference and literal configuration fully define the action.
property.summary: Specifies an existing object with default property values for the dynamic object
property.name: Default

schema.summary: The OAuth token provider settings to use
schema.name: OAuthProviderSettingsReference
SupportedOAuthComponents

value.name: OAuthValidateRequest
value.description: Validates the incoming request from the client.

value.name: OAuthGenerateAZCode
value.description: Generates the authorization code for the client, which represents the resource owner's authorization that grants access to the requested resource.

value.name: OAuthVerifyAZCode
value.description: Verifies the authorization code from the client.

value.name: OAuthVerifyRefreshToken
value.description: Verifies the refresh token from the client.

value.name: OAuthCollectMetadata
value.description: Collect metadata from authentication url and metadata url.

value.name: OAuthGenerateAccessToken
value.description: Generates the access token to the client when the authorization code or refresh token is verified.

value.name: OAuthIntrospectToken
value.description: Introspects the token to determine its state. When the state is active, introspects its metadata.

schema.description: Specifies the OAuth components that the action supports. When the action does not support a component but that component is requested, the unsupported component is not run.
